items.title: Software Quality Assurance Analyst at Cardinal Intellectual Property, Inc. (Evanston, IL) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Legal
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

The Software Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst is responsible for the planning, execution, and reporting of the software quality assurance process. The QA Analyst is tasked with both System testing of web applications and perform regression/integration testing of software applications going through enhancements and new releases, and collaborate with other QA team members, application developers and business stakeholders to accurately test the applications to ensure functional requirements are accurately translated into software products.

This is a full-time W-2 relationship position and may be considered for remote work for candidates within the United States.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Develops functional, integration, and regression testing approaches, plans, and scripts for all applications and major IT systems.
  • Coordinating with business and technical members in determining the testable elements of functional and technical designs.
  • Executing testing scripts, and where required overseeing the execution of testing scripts in the execution of functional, integration and regression testing.
  • Logging and tracking to closure the bugs discovered in functional, integration, and regression testing.
  • Summarizing and providing reporting and analysis on the progress of testing on a daily and weekly basis.
  • Documenting the final results of functional, integration and regression testing.


Education and Experience:
 

  • Bachelor's Degree; Computers or related discipline preferred but not required.
  • Test Automation proficiency using tools like Selenium Remote WebDriver for at least 5 years.
  • Experience testing large asp.net web applications for at least 5 years
  • Experience with C#, NUnit and TeamCity.
  • A working knowledge of Test Approaches, Test Plans and Test Scripts.
  • Proficient in the use of a PC and Microsoft Office tools.
  • Experience in the Intellectual Property or in working with patents is preferred but not required.
  • Experience writing automated scripts or with performance testing is a plus, but not required.
  • A paralegal certificate is preferred but not required.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
 

  • Demonstrate decision making, problem solving, and analytical skills with attention given to detail and accuracy.
  • Strong verbal and written and communication skills.
  • Demonstrate a cooperative positive attitude and effective interpersonal and communication skills with clients, coworkers, and other stakeholders.
  • Demonstrate flexibility and the ability to work as a member of an Agile/Scrum development team.
  • Ability to work with minimal direction and to make good decisions according to direction from Manager.
  • Willingness to learn new tools and technologies to improve efficiency in their job.

About Cardinal Intellectual Property, Inc.

Cardinal Intellectual Property, largest of the group, is the IP industry's leading IP Services Company. As the premier provider of patent research, Cardinal has been contracted by the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office to conduct their searches for PCT applications.

Cardinal also provides technology solutions for IP Management including Invention Disclosure, Processing, Docketing, E-Discovery, and Competitive Monitoring. Our technology platforms incorporate rigorous security and data protection standards. We maintain confidentiality for our clients using the same diligence and procedures as a law firm. We do not outsource our software or research services, enabling the Cardinal group to maintain the highest standards of quality, confidentiality, and accountability.

Benefits We Offer

  • Insurance benefits are provided and include Health, Dental, vision, Short-term Disability, and Life Insurance
  • 401(K) benefits
  • Transportation Reimbursement benefits for in-office employees (parking, CTA and Metro)
  • Paid Time-Off benefits
  • Paid Holidays

Cardinal Intellectual Property, Inc. provides equal opportunity in employment to all employees and applicants for employment. No person will be discriminated against in employment because of race, religion, color, sex, gender, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, disability, sexual orientation, military status, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable Federal, State or local statute or ordinance.

Benefits

Transportation Reimbursement
401(K)
Insurance Benefits
Paid Time Off

items.title: QA Automation Engineer - ABC Financial Services, Inc. - Remote
items.content:
QA Automation Engineer
ABC Financial Services, Inc. -Remote
SUMMARY

The QA Automation Engineer (QAE) is a test engineer who plays a critical role in the agile development team and is primarily responsible for designing, developing, and implementing test frameworks, test validation scripts, and test data strategies within an integrated DevOps infrastructure covering the full product stack.

This position will also be responsible for coordinating quality assurance testing activities including understanding business requirements, features, and technical implementation along with drafting test documentation, executing test scripts, tracking defects, and monitoring testing activity. The QAE will serve as a subject matter expert on the development of testing approaches and methodologies. The QAE work is critical in driving the testing efficiencies necessary for successful agile product development.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
  • Plan, implement, and maintain the strategy to ensure full automated testing of applications, API’s, and frameworks as part of a continuous integration and agile environment.
  • Define test plans, test cases, and test data to be used for both automated and manual testing.
  • Create and perform thorough automation test strategies to ensure comprehensive code coverage, and write test cases that cover all areas.
  • Identify missing test scenarios and refine existing automation.
  • Develop high quality automated tests to support development and ensure high quality software.
  • Identify and create reusable test data, methods, and frameworks.
  • During each sprint, ensure that all necessary tests meet the acceptance criteria, staying on top of all important issues and helping triage bugs and drive issues to resolution, keeping everyone aware of the quality of the sprint work.
  • Define Functional Automation Coverage Map, ensuring visibility to all the stakeholders and members of the Agile Team.
  • Work with other quality team members on test automation strategies across the product stack.
  • Investigate failures, perform root cause analysis, and utilize the internal defect tracking tool to create detailed, high quality defect reports.
  • Assure quality assurance in the evaluation of critical code fixes to determine ship readiness and help make sure that each release goes out on time with high quality.
  • Proactively identify & share new automation tools/processes/approaches to create, maintain and improve the Software Testing Lifecycle.
  • Coordinate with hardware team to ensure all testing needs are met.
  • Produce status reports related to the testing process, including test results and defect tracking/prioritization.
  • Participate in Requirements Reviews and Grooming sessions.
  • Participate in Lessons Learned or Project Review/Retrospective sessions, and identify potential work process improvements.
  • Work with cross-team product owners, developers and other test engineers to support the current QA processes.
  • Be a vocal advocate of customer empathy and risk mitigation.
  • Help develop and drive a Test Culture across the entire company, which includes following the Agile testing principles and continuously reviewing, implementing, and communicating process improvements and quality metrics to the team.

Position Requirements
Qualifications
  • In-depth knowledge and experience with software testing and automated test techniques with a strong focus on quality throughout the entire software development cycle
  • Knowledge and experience writing custom test automation scripts and frameworks, in Java, JavaScript or C/C++
  • Knowledge using backend Test Automation Frameworks from Junit and NUnit such as TestNG
  • Knowledge using frontend Test Automation Frameworks such as Selenium Webdriver, to test responsive web applications
  • Knowledge and experience with multiple test automation framework tools, including Linear, Modular, Data Driven, Keyword Driven, and/or Hybrid framework types
  • Experience with :
    • RESTful API web service execution and validation using tools such as Postman or SOAP
    • API Contract verification using tools such as Swagger or REST Docs
    • Committing code to a version control system such as GitHub or SVN
    • Build automation tools, such as Gradle or Apache Maven
    • Developing and executing automated and manual test scripts for requirement validation, integration, regression, performance and usability testing
    • Load testing APIs and Applications using tools such as Jmeter or LoadUI
    • Integrating automated tests into continuous integration pipelines using tools such as Jenkins or Hudson
    • An agile tracking tool such as JIRA or VersionOne
    • A Test Management Tool such as TestRail or qTest
Education and/or Experience
  • BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, equivalent technical degree, or experience
  • 3 - 8 years of professional software automation / development experience

Relocation Assistance
N/A - Remote

Travel Requirements
Remote Travel: Onsite initially for 3 weeks of training and team integration, 1 week/month for the next 2 months (after your initial training), and 1 week/quarter thereafter.

EOE Statement
We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

This position is currently accepting applications.

items.title: QA Analyst
items.content:
QA Analyst - Jobmote

QA Analyst

CROmetrics

_ Our positions are fully remote and to ensure compliance with all applicable labor laws, are open to U.S.-based applicants only. Not hiring in Washington state, Oregon state, San Francisco, or New York. _

_### What We Do _

Simply put, we make websites easier to use. Through a scientific method of determining which site improvements result in actual performance improvements, we replace the old way of designing sites through gut feel and management opinions with designing sites through data.

If you’re interested in checking out the swell people you’ll be working with, click here to learn more about the team.

Our Hiring Process

We’re glad you’re interested in working with us. We have a fairly unusual hiring process, but it has proven to work well both for us and for potential new hires. We have found that demonstrating basic competency is the best predictor of initial qualification for working with us, followed by actual work.

Our process reflects that: below, we outline our values and how we work, and then ask you to complete a small task. Assuming we like your response, we will hire you for a “paid interview” where you start working with us for a small number of hours each week. If both parties like working together, we expand the relationship. If not, we go our separate ways and both sides “won” in the deal!

This short essay sums up the philosophy we operate by: This is Professionalism. Please read it and if you’re willing to work this way, read on!

If you have questions as you go through this, make notes and if we haven’t answered them by the end, feel free to email matthew.gossage@crometrics.com, chris@crometrics.com or tom@crometrics.com.

Our Culture

  • We’re a remote company.  We are spread out all over the country and enjoy the flexibility remote working affords. Want to go on a mountain bike ride in the middle of the day? Cool, don’t forget your helmet! Need to pick the kids up from school? Nice, you’ve got parent of the year in the bag. We stay connected through Slack and workcations, including one annual trip that is partially funded by the company.
  • We work hard and move fast.  We’re working on a lot of different websites with varying underlying technologies. You’ll see a lot of pages and forms and there’s not a lot of automation. Maintaining quality while working on so much requires more than just checking boxes, you’ll need to think critically.
  • Again, we’re a remote company.  That makes communication — including writing and reading comprehension — extremely important. You’ll work closely with product managers, designers and writers. This is not a simple “pull tickets and check in code” gig. Successful applicants enjoy the process of defining and clarifying specs, documenting processes, improving processes, and uploading custom emoji to Slack.

items.title: Leadership opportunity for QA Engineer on Solutions Focused Remote Team at InventoryLab Inc. () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: SaaS
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

*Open to US residents only. We do not sponsor employment visas.*

At InventoryLab we are redefining the workflow of thousands of Amazon sellers. Our product simplifies product sourcing, inventory management, Amazon listing, and profitability analysis for our customers. We are looking to add A-grade players to our customer-driven team to meet increased demand and support our exciting future plans.

We are searching for a Software Quality Assurance Engineer confident in taking our good QA function to world-class status. We need a player/coach that can check all the boxes on this list:

  • QA pro that has already turned out high-quality software while improving throughput.
  • Connected QA industry sponge that is on top of trends and knows what works.
  • Leader who can analyze a QA landscape, see areas to improve, and make it stronger.
  • Loves collaborating throughout the entirety of the SDLC with a distributed team (SW Development, Product Manager, Designer, Customer Champions) of talented players.
  • Makes quality happen on the input side and not just the output side - partner in the design and definition of new features or enhancements with your QA lens.
  • Roll-up-your-sleeves software tester that can build and execute manual/automated unit/integration/regression/smoke tests effectively and knows when to use them.
  • Fast learner that can see the big picture and speaks up when something doesn’t feel right.
  • People leader that can get the most from the SQA Analysts on your team.

How we get it done:

  • Our focus is on how we can continue to provide an optimal user experience.
  • We use Jira for product management, issue reporting, ideology, and documentation.
  • Basecamp is our project management and team communication tool of choice.
  • We rely on TestRail to keep our testing efforts sorted out.

What we are looking for:

  • You have at least 2 years experience as a SQA Engineer.
  • You have at least 2 years experience managing or supervising a team.
  • You have successfully put SQA processes in place before.
  • You know your way around software design, programming and automated testing software.
  • You live for details. You understand that details are the difference between a failed and successful release. In fact, when we ask you later, you will tell us that your favorite color is Island Blue!
  • You have a BS in Computer Information Systems, or related experience.
  • You are self-driven and can thrive as part of a remote team.

What will set you apart:

  • Someone who cares more about getting the product right than being right.
  • Experience with Agile/Lean Methodologies.
  • You have navigated the challenges of working remotely and are fully prepared to work within them.
  • A little coding knowledge goes a long way so let us know what you know. C# and Java knowledge get extra points.
  • You’ve sold in, worked with, or been frustrated by the API’s of online marketplaces in your past.

About InventoryLab Inc.

At InventoryLab we work in small multidisciplinary teams to plan next steps and give advice but we all are responsible for making it happen. You will have the freedom, and responsibility, to chart your own course. Working at InventoryLab means choosing your own work location every day, responsible time off, and a full benefits package.

Benefits

Technology you need
401K with company match
8 Paid Holidays
Responsible Time Off policy
Health & Fitness Reimbursement
Home Office Allowance
Health Insurance
Dental/Vision Insurance

items.title: Mobile Test Engineer (iOS & Android) - Remote at Creatubbles () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer, QA/Test Developer
Industry: Information Technology, Social Networking
Company size: 11-50 people

Job description

Creatubbles™ is the safe global community for creators of all ages. It is the perfect space for children, families and teachers to save, share, discover and interact with multimedia creativity portfolios. It lets anyone share their experiences and creations safely in more than 50 countries, whether they are at home, school, an event or activity.

We recognize creativity is a critical life skill to be developed and nurtured like any other form of expression. We believe in the importance of finding and developing your individual voice by being able to express thoughts and ideas freely.

Creatubbles™ is an integrated creativity ecosystem with a growing list of partners that believe in nurturing creativity through a safe and supportive environment.

About our company

We are an ambitious team of around 25 people, covering 14 nationalities and operating as a network of virtual teams around the world.

To fulfill our mission to nurture the original creativity of children around the world, we are constantly exploring new ways to incorporate the latest ideas, approaches, and technologies into our products and services.

At Creatubbles, you will be helping to build a product that serves not only the future of the world, but the parents and the teachers that guide them as well.

Main site: https://www.creatubbles.com
Blog: https://stateoftheart.creatubbles.com

About our development Team and Technologies
- We start the day with a standup call and organise our work in weekly iterations.
- Slack, Trello, Github, CircleCI and Amazon AWS are just a couple of the many friends we rely on every single day.
- ScreenHero allows us to enjoy pair­-programming sessions, even when members are located on the other side of the world.
- Our focus is to build and keep iterating on universal experiences and interfaces that work for and delight users between ages of 1 and 99.
- The back­end is made available to our web app, our native mobile apps and our partner's applications as a simple REST API.
- Security is extremely important to us as want our own kids to use our apps in a safe way.
- We follow a Balanced Teams approach whereby design/development/testing is tightly integrated.
- Our PMs keep tabs on the work to be done and prepare detailed acceptance criteria for each task.


About you
- You have experience working with testing native iOS and Android mobile apps (and Web app test experience is a big plus).
- You are a hero when it comes to manual testing but also know how to leverage crowd-based solutions like test.io
- You know your way with APIs and how to test apps that rely on them.
- You insist on clean and well-­maintained code with a good amount of test coverage that leads to beautiful user-­interfaces. You have experience with data­-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc
- You have experience writing tests in some sort of xUnit framework.
- You take quality and testing very seriously. Very very seriously. Obviously.
- You are fluent in spoken and written English (knowledge of Japanese is a big plus).
- You have a pro­active personality, are a real team player and feel comfortable working in a fast-­paced tech startup environment.
- You have a fundamental interest in what we are doing and show empathy for our users.
- You have a general curiosity and an ability to embrace complexity.
- Ideally you are based somewhere in the European time zone to maximize work time overlap with our development teams.

Benefits

Remote

items.title: Senior Software Quality Engineer at EMS Software (Greenwood Village, CO) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Enterprise Software
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

What will you do? You will be responsible for software testing, working within a product team and with the individuals on that team to execute our technical testing strategies, including our test automation strategy. You will also provide technical advice and assistance on test tools, test planning, and test design – with an emphasis on test automation. You will provide recommendations in regards to technical approaches, deployments, tool uses, and integrations. 

Who are you?

  • You are an early adopter of tools and technology and understand that the automation of tests and other tasks is one component of a good quality engineer.
  • You bring your brain to work. You’re not a rookie and you know how to assess a situation or platform and recommend solutions.
  • Because you’re a professional, you know what needs to be done and you know how to work with stakeholders to make it happen.
  • You’re a Software Tester that has worked within different SDLC methodologies (Agile, waterfall, etc.).
  • You understand how to design a testing solution based on good testing practices and you use test automation concepts and tools to enhance that solution.
  • You’re able to research root causes around issues and identify, recommend and execute solutions.
  • You’ve contributed to automation strategies and you write tests using tools and other technology forums based on your deep testing knowledge.
  • You are a technical testing expert and you have created and/or contributed to one or more testing frameworks and you can speak to the differences between them.
  • You can provide informal knowledge transition and/or hands-on training with other team members.
  • You have the ability to adapt and learn from coworkers and share information and experiences in a variety of communication modes.
  • You are flexible and adaptable when needed, but you know when to deep dive and focus on the task at hand.
  • You both contribute to and consume from the Software Testing community in the form of writing or speaking and stay up on current trends and technologies in order to enhance your career and professional development.

Your Skills

  • You have experience with: object-oriented programming languages (C#, Java), .NET technologies, SQL/TSQL (including DML/DDL/function commands), stored procedures, DB Tracing, DB Profiling/SQL Profiler, impact analysis, DB sharding, JavaScript, AJAX, JSON, XPath.
  • You have expertise and a strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles and can consult on coding to support test automation.
  • You have experience in Web Services (SOAP, REST) and automated testing tools (g., Selenium, WebDriver API, SoapUI, Cucumber) and mobile and performance testing strategies.
  • You have experience with scripting languages, preferably Windows PowerShell and batch scripting.
  • You know how to integrate third party APIs/tools from GITHUB or any other open sources as automation needs arise.
  • You have strong working knowledge and implementation practice of software development life-cycle and testing tools.
  • You like to learn and actively seek new skills and knowledge to keep up with the changing technology field, including bringing new ideas to the team. 

About EMS Software

EMS Software offers the most comprehensive, cutting-edge platform to enable innovative work and learning environments. We make it easier to connect people with space, resources, and technology – allowing them to collaborate flawlessly, make informed business decisions, and get more out of each day.

EMS Software is an equal opportunity employer. In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at EMS Software will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. EMS Software does not discriminate against any person because of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, age or any other characteristic protected by law.

Benefits

Medical, dental and vision plans
Physical fitness reimbursement plan and on-site fitness center
Self-Directed PTO
Flexible work environment and remote work options
Competitive compensation and employer-matched 401(k) savings plan
"Bug hunts," casual dress code, open floor plan, collaboration spaces
Two blocks from the Arapahoe Village Center RTD Station
Walking distance to numerous bars, restaurants and coffee shops

Role: QA/Test Developer

Company type: Private

Job description

We are seeking an experienced QA lead to shape the QA function at Daily Kos. Currently most QA at Daily Kos is done manually and the responsibility is spread across a few people on staff who also have other roles. This QA Engineer will be the first dedicated hire for QA and will have a significant role in shaping the department as we expand our development team and build out more capacity for automated testing. Applicants should be self-sufficient and comfortable working independently. In addition we are looking for someone who:

  • can clearly and precisely document bugs and the steps to reproduce them
  • can write and follow detailed test plans for new features
  • can use the JavaScript console, debugger, and other browser developer tools
  • can write and run raw SQL queries in MySQL or PostgreSQL; knowledge of other data storage a plus
  • can read Ruby and JavaScript code 
  • has awareness of typical programming errors and the unexpected things users do whether accidentally or maliciously
  • has exposure to performance and security testing
  • has exposure to front-end automated testing tools
  • can summon a maddeningly creative approach to breaking things and other chaos monkey skills
  • enjoys using the Daily Kos application in general
  • will advocate for our users both internally and externally to ensure they have the reliable tools that they need and do what they need and expect

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective in our work, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal-opportunity workplace. We're a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees.

To apply, please send an email to tech_jobs@dailykos.com with the name of the position in the subject line, a cover letter, code sample or github repo and your resume (include your LinkedIn profile link).

About Daily Kos (Kos Media LLC)

DailyKos, the leading online progressive blogging and activism platform, is looking for an Intermediate/Senior Software QA Engineer.

DailyKos is a great place to work-- your code will be used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to effect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond. If you want a job that provides more than just a technical challenge, we'd love to hear from you.

The job offers a flexible work environment, the ability to work remotely (US only, please) on a distributed team of self-sufficient collaborators, competitive salary and benefits, and we provide an Apple MacBook Pro or your preferred comparable hardware. Our organization’s commitment to personal growth reduces churn and encourages a very rewarding long term position. We have an energized team filled with great people with different backgrounds.

Benefits

100% Medical Coverage
6 weeks paid vacation per year
401K Plan

items.title: Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst
items.content:
Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst - Jobmote

Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst

Modern Tribe

The Opportunity

Modern Tribe’s QA team works on a lot of cool projects: over the past year alone, we’ve tested sites built by our dev team for big-name clients including Columbia Law School, Bon Appetit Magazine, Eventbright Academy Blog, Harvard Law School and What Should We Do (WSWD). (Want to see how we did? The links above highlight some of our work). And that’s not even including our family of WordPress plugins led by The Events Calendar.

We’ve got a slew of cool projects we are working on in 2017, and need another member for our QA team. If working on high-profile sites for large clients gets you excited and a serious case of attention to detail is your jam, we should talk.

Responsibilities

QA is responsible for ensuring all aspects of quality at Modern Tribe. It’s a tall order for sure: learning how a site works, creating test plans covering obscure use cases, and then putting it all into practice when testing every aspect of site functionality…it’s a lot of ground to cover. But we’ve got an established workflow down that helps make sure we’re setting the team up with the tools they need to proceed and succeed.

Though every project is different, here’s the gist of our QA flow:

  • KICKOFF MEETING.  Just a kickoff — meet the PM; get your questions answered; set expectations; and schedule milestones.
  • PREPARING DOCS.  Getting started with internal documentation early is hugely important to getting the project into your brain.
  • REVIEW APPROVED COMPS.  Before you start QA or even get a walkthrough, you’ll review the comps to understand the project + prepare a list of questions to ask on the QA walkthrough.
  • QA WALKTHROUGH.  Once development is far enough along for QA to begin, you’ll do a walkthrough with the lead developer to get an overview of the functionality.
  • PREPARE QA CHECKLIST + TEST PLAN.  After seeing each component of the site in action, you’ll put together a first draft at a comprehensive QA checklist and a higher-level overview of what you’re planning to test, in what order, and when.
  • HEAVY DUTY TESTING.  You’ll put the site through its paces and give it a few rounds of full pass bug hunting. Beyond just hitting buttons, you’ll be thinking from a higher level: are there usability concerns? Does what we’re doing here actually make sense as the best way to solve the problem? etc.

  • CELEBRATING A SUCCESSFUL LAUNCH.  What feels better than kicking back after a successful launch? If QA has done their job, the project will launch smoothly, the team will have a finished product to show off, and — most importantly — the client will be happy. It doesn’t get much better than that.

  • Our QA team also generally leads client training and prepares training documentation/videos when appropriate, so be prepared for some direct client communication.

Personal Competencies

  • Extremely outgoing and friendly attitude
  • Strong communication skills
  • Experience working as part of a remote team
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented
  • Strong organizational skills
  • A methodical approach to all tasks
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Fluent English speaker

Knowledge and Experience

  • Has a proven track record in Quality Assurance.
  • Pays meticulous attention to detail + fights for the customer. Being able to catch bugs is huge, but it isn’t everything — QA is most effective when it puts itself in the customer or end user’s shoes.
  • Knows WordPress well, you’ll be expected to prove your familiarity with the platform.
  • Excellent verbal, non-verbal and written communication skills
  • Has 1+ year remote freelancing experience.

Bonus Points

  • Familiarity setting up local WordPress environments + cloning GIT repositories locally
  • Skills at training others how to admin complex WordPress sites/projects
  • Experience writing and implementing automated testing processes

Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).

Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY  Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL  Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS  It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE  Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.
  • A FREELANCER  This means that if you live within the USA, you will also maintain your own personal client list and that Modern Tribe will only comprise a portion of your total income. Regardless of where you live, you need to be already freelancing.

Location

Work from anywhere in the US or Canada; if you are in Central or South America, let’s talk. This will be a 100% remote position.  If your working hours are in a timezone outside of the US range, but you work 4+ hours of overlap each day our team might be able to consider your application.

Compensation

Our hourly rate for this gig starts at $25-$35/hr, depending on experience, with opportunities for rate bumps on annual review. This gig is about 8 hours per week of work to start and ramping up to about 15 -20 hours over the next 2 -3 months. This is a one time contract position, though we are always seeking longer relationships with kick-ass people.

items.title: Leadership Opportunity For QA Engineer On Solutions Focused Team
items.content:
*Open to US residents only. We do not sponsor employment visas.*


At InventoryLab we are redefining the workflow of thousands of Amazon sellers. Our product simplifies product sourcing, inventory management, Amazon listing, and profitability analysis for our customers. We are looking to add A-grade players to our customer-driven team to meet increased demand and support our exciting future plans.


We are searching for a Software Quality Assurance Engineer confident in taking our good QA function to world-class status. We need a player/coach that can check all the boxes on this list:



  • QA pro that has already turned out high-quality software while improving throughput.

  • Connected QA industry sponge that is on top of trends and knows what works.

  • Leader who can analyze a QA landscape, see areas to improve, and make it stronger.

  • Loves collaborating throughout the entirety of the SDLC with a distributed team (SW Development, Product Manager, Designer, Customer Champions) of talented players.

  • Makes quality happen on the input side and not just the output side - partner in the design and definition of new features or enhancements with your QA lens.

  • Roll-up-your-sleeves software tester that can build and execute manual/automated unit/integration/regression/smoke tests effectively and knows when to use them.

  • Fast learner that can see the big picture and speaks up when something doesn’t feel right.

  • People leader that can get the most from the SQA Analysts on your team.


How we get it done:



  • Our focus is on how we can continue to provide an optimal user experience.

  • We use Jira for product management, issue reporting, ideology, and documentation.

  • Basecamp is our project management and team communication tool of choice.

  • We rely on TestRail to keep our testing efforts sorted out.


What we are looking for:



  • You have at least 2 years experience as a SQA Engineer.

  • You have at least 2 years experience managing or supervising a team.

  • You have successfully put SQA processes in place before.

  • You know your way around software design, programming and automated testing software.

  • You live for details. You understand that details are the difference between a failed and successful release. In fact, when we ask you later, you will tell us that your favorite color is Island Blue!

  • You have a BS in Computer Information Systems, or related experience.

  • You are self-driven and can thrive as part of a remote team.


What will set you apart:



  • Someone who cares more about getting the product right than being right.

  • Experience with Agile/Lean Methodologies.

  • You have navigated the challenges of working remotely and are fully prepared to work within them.

  • A little coding knowledge goes a long way so let us know what you know. C# and Java knowledge get extra points.

  • You’ve sold in, worked with, or been frustrated by the API’s of online marketplaces in your past.

items.title: Test Automation Architect - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Test Automation Architect
Crossover -Remote
$60,000 a year - Contract
Are you an expert in Test Automation? Do you pride yourself in being 10 times more productive than the typical test architect? Are you interested in earning $60K USD, living anywhere in the world, while working for a leading technology company? If you are eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world, than this role is for you.

Company Description:Aureais partnering withCrossoverto fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in today’s global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Aureaenables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touchpoints to accelerate growth through an excellent customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.

Job Description:We are seeking a technical guru who thrives in solving complex problems for customers with high expectations. The position is a great fit for someone who takes a truly hands-on approach to product development, design and engineering. It's a great opportunity to secure a high-impact technical lead role in a rapidly-growing global software company that is expanding both organically and through acquisitions. The opportunity to grow and address new challenges is infinite, as the acquisition of several new products and customer bases every year creates interesting learning opportunities for motivated professionals who strive to craft value in their work and grow personally.

We offer a fast-paced environment where you will play a dynamic technical leadership role. You will be responsible for developing test automation solutions to complex systems, establishing and implementing automated testing strategies and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner of the technical solution, you will understand the current large enterprise product automation frameworks and identify the opportunities for optimization and improvements such as multi-threading. Contributions to the team involve resolving challenging issues with complex automation tasks/requirements. You will work with existing SMEs to understand their expertise developed over the years and become the go-to person for the teams.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for automation infrastructure that will integrate development activities with tools for metric collection and reporting

  • Set definitions and guidelines for subsystem, integration, regression and exploratory tests.

  • You will be developing expertise in our Test Automation design and implementation.

  • Bringing to bear your broad technology capabilities and maintaining a level of excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy Test Automation.

  • Obtaining an expert level understanding of our current product environments and the use of our products.

  • Maintaining an excellent understanding of our current automation frameworks and bringing continuous improvements.

  • Solving day-to-day issues/challenges faced by the large automation teams and becoming a go-to person for any automation help.

  • Monitoring overall test execution and deep dive into the failures and work with the teams to get them fixed.

  • Creating solution architecture for new automation frameworks as required.

  • Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

  • Ensuring our customers are supremely confident in the advantages and quality of our product and solution, and the technical services you lead to deliver them.

Required Education and Experience:
  • A successful Full Stack Architect with Test Automation at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree from a top university in Computer Science, Computer Engineering.

  • At least 8 years of experience in hands-on implementation and execution of automated test strategies within various technical and functional contexts.

  • Experience developing automated UI and API test case framework.

  • Experience with Java, Python, AWS, Unix, Linux

  • Expertise industry standard frameworks and tools such Java Robot Framework/ Selenium/Cucumber/etc.

  • Expertise in defining testing automation strategies for enterprise solutions.

  • Experience in leading teams

  • Excellent understanding of current enterprise software technologies and development practices/tools, including virtual environments, source control, remote development, issue tracking, build and test automation, and networking management

You might be a great fit if:
  • You are able to engage sophisticated global customers in deep technical discussions, making them confident that you know their problem better than they do

  • You have a true “roll up the sleeves and get it done” working approach; demonstrated success as a problem solver, operating with end results in mind, self-starter

  • You are comfortable “working virtually” with teammates and customers around the world

Pay:$30/hror$60K/year

Commitment:40hours/week

Location:Global(remote)

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

However, it is important to note that while you will work as a "contractor," these are long-term contracts that should be your only source of employment. You are not permitted to work additional jobs on the side. Please do not apply unless you are available to make this position your sole employment.

Toqualify, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online skills examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time - so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

items.title: Senior Automation Engineers
items.content:
About you

If you care about software quality but find testing and QA tedious, maybe you are curious whether there might be a better way.
Do you love bridging skill-gaps and enabling others to do more and achieve more? We would like to hear from you.

About us

We are SpotQA's Product Team, building the next generation of testing automation software.
We are building the self-driving car technology for the testing world.
Our objective? To develop new technology that uses machine-learning and domain expertise with the aim of performing testing fully autonomously
To help with our mission, we are looking for a Senior Automation Architect to join our team. Ideally, the following responsibilities should resonate with you:
Lead the design, development and creation of internal/external tools to help people do more and achieve more.
Ensure automated testing frameworks are designed, built, and structured to support testing automation. Publish test methodologies and package test frameworks for customers to follow and use for testing their applications.
Drive team adoption of latest testing standards, tools and frameworks within software development cycles.
Function as Thought Leader for automated testing expertise.

REQUIREMENTS

Most importantly, we are looking for can-do attitudes, with a passion to help others and delving into challenging problems.

We also have our eyes on a few skills, namely the following:

Can quickly get your hands dirty for scripting and becoming a Principal Engineer whenever necessary to solve problems.
8-10 years of experience developing quality automation solutions in a technology firm.
Comfortable with a wide range of software technologies: Java, Popular IDEs (IntelliJ/Eclipse), Build Systems (Maven, Gradle).
Proven experience with full-stack testing – unit testing, API & UI testing, non-functional testing.
Hands on experience with multiple test automation tools – JUnit, Selenium, Jmeter.
Expert in planning, tracking and monitoring the projects.
Exceptional reporting skills and ability to give flawless demonstrations to customers and colleagues.
Significant expertise leading cross functional global projects and initiatives.
Ability to work effectively with remote teams across geographical boundaries in a fast paced, diverse, agile environment.
Ability to work effectively with diverse stakeholders including other technical leads, Product Owners, and executive management.

BENEFITS

Competitive Salary.
Possibility of working remotely is available.
Personal development by working with a fast growing multinational startup aiming to shape the future of Digital QA.

items.title: Learning Tapestry: QA Lead Engineer - Nearshore - Remote
items.content:
QA Lead Engineer - Nearshore - Remote

Posted Oct 26

Learning Tapestry
Headquarters: Berkeley, CA
https://jobs.enlist.io/learning_tapestry/jobs/7e96e9c0-f7b1-449c-bfa8-6bf774f368b3

About Learning Tapestry

Hi! We're Learning Tapestry. We're a 35+ person all-remote, global organization dedicated to making digital learning "just work" for educators and learners alike. We solve hard problems in complex education technology environments. We’re a triple bottom line company: we make a profit like any good business; our work makes the world better (“social impact”); and we create a healthy internal work environment for everyone who works here. For our staff we believe in flexible work locations and working arrangements. We empower all of our team members to manage their schedules and adjust as necessary. We're focused on results and impact, not locations and hours. We hire people with great technical ability, but we also expect everyone at Learning Tapestry to have a strong character and solid communication skills.

What We're Looking For

Our client list is growing quickly, so we're looking for a Quality Assurance Lead Engineer to help us deliver exceptional solutions for our clients, and to help us build a strong QA practice (and team, in the near future). The position is full-time and remote. To minimize timezone challenges, you should be available for working for at least 4 hours of your time every day with US/Eastern time zone business hours (8am - 6pm).

About You

  • You’ve got 5+ years as a QA engineer/analyst with increasing levels of responsibility throughout your career. You’ve worked on a wide variety of projects, from new development to taking over maintenance of an existing test suite.
  • You’re comfortable in a remote work environment, with team members from different time zones. You can manage your own time and are a self-starter.
  • You are experienced and fluent in the productivity tools we use, like Google Apps & Hangouts, Slack, and Harvest for time tracking.
  • You’re comfortable hiring, leading and managing a team of QA engineers. We have a couple of contracted QA people on staff now, and that could grow.
  • You have experience developing and writing test plans for large software development initiatives, and working with clients to verify signoff of delivered functionality.
  • You’ve got demonstrable experience developing new tests and maintaining test suites in Ruby (with rspec, minitest, capybara, or similar), mobile (iOS, Android or React Native), javascript (mocha, chai, jest, etc) or .NET. In an ideal case you’ve got experience with more than one of these.
  • You’ve developed and executed cross-browser testing, using Browserstack, Sauce Labs, or similar.
  • You’re comfortable with git for version control, and have used Github for reviewing pull requests.

Bonus Skills

  • You’re an especially strong candidate if you have experience writing tests for automated test frameworks like Selenium or appium, and integrating a test suite with Continuous Integration tools, and software development lifecycles using Github or Bitbucket.
  • You’ve used several issue trackers in your career, like Github issues, Asana, Jira, or Redmine and you have strong opinions about which you prefer, and why.

Please do not hesitate to apply if you do not match these requirements exactly but think you could be a good fit.

Equal Opportunity

Learning Tapestry is an equal opportunity employer and encourages individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds, sexual orientations, and gender identities to apply. We are also particularly interested in individuals who have lived in or worked with underserved communities such as low-income, gender nonconforming, disabled, or indigenous peoples.

Apply for this position

Fill out the online application here: https://jobs.enlist.io/learning_tapestry/jobs/7e96e9c0-f7b1-449c-bfa8-6bf774f368b3

items.title: QA Engineer
items.content:
QA Engineer
Location : Central London

Who are we

Twickets was created by music fan, Richard Davies, who made the simple observation that real
fans don’t want to rip other fans off. When we have tickets we can no longer use, most of us
don’t want to sell them for a profit. We just don’t want them to go to waste and are really happy
if we can get our money back. So Richard set up Twickets as a service on Twitter, connecting
fans and allowing them to trade with each other at strictly no more than face value.
Today, Twickets is the largest fan-to-fan marketplace for face value tickets and connects fans
via both website and app (iOS and Android) across three continents. Thousands of tickets are
listed every month for gigs, festivals, sports, comedy, theatre and the arts.
We are growing rapidly, and have attracted support from the industry through our event
partners, investors and the media. Our platform and technologies are constantly evolving as we
strive to innovate and expand into new territories.
We allow ticket resale both on a private basis and through integrations with artists, promoters,
ticket agencies, sporting organisations and venues.

Our Tech

Our backend platform is a Java stack, using Spring, CXF, Thrift, Cassandra, RabbitMQ and
Postgresql, all running on AWS. We deliver everything through web services (REST/JSON) to
the frontend system.
Frontends are written in Bootstrap / AngularJS (the main web site), Android & iOS and for
internally facing web applications, Vaadin framework.

The Role

We are looking for keen, self motivated individual to join our development team at Twickets as a
QA. Our product is a web application, its written in Angular.JS (front end) and Java (backend)
and native mobile apps for the two main mobile platforms. We currently do a combination of
testing by hand and automated testing. Each feature is developed and tested in isolation thenretested at the end of the sprint. You will work closely with the product owner throughout to
make sure that you know the stories being developed and help define acceptance criteria, you
will then test each story as soon as is has come out of code review, and complete final product
testing once all stories in the sprint are complete.
When not actively testing new features, you will be working on improving and extending our
automated test suite, implementing new types of test, all helping assure quality of our product.
Essential skills

You should be a good communicator, a team player and always improving your own skills and
those of others around you. You need to be able to quickly get up to speed with technical
concepts. You should also be strong in the following skills:

- Management of the testing process
- Functional Testing
- Exploratory Testing
- Agile Process
- Continuous Integration
- Version control systems, Git
- HTML/CSS/Javascript
- SQL Databases
Other skills and qualifications
A good degree or similar from a well regarded university or commensurate industry experience
would be beneficial. Also, experience with:
- Integration testing
- Testing mobile applications
- Testing Automation frameworks (selenium, protractor)

The Benefits

● You will be enrolled onto a workplace pension scheme
● Central London offices just off Oxford Street
● Free Kitchen with breakfast, fruit, beer fridge and refreshments
● Gig / event tickets
● Opportunity for remote working

Description

DESCRIPTION

SuperAwesome (@GoSuperAwesome) is the largest kids digital media platform in the world, reaching over a quarter of a billion kids each month across mobile, web and online video. SuperAwesome’s technology and products power kid-safe advertising, parent-portals and COPPA compliance for hundreds of brands and agencies around the world. Recently named in London’s future 50 (http://futurefifty.com/2017-cohort/), we continue to grow at a fast pace with some of the biggest clients on the planet including Lego, Warner Bros, Hasbro, Spin Master, Nintendo and many others.

We are looking for various developer roles across the company, one of which is to help us build out a world class test automation suite that allows us to move our products from development to production in the most streamlined and robust way possible.

The role would see you own the set-up, development and deployment of our automated testing suite, giving you the full freedom and flexibility to use the tools and languages of your choosing. This is a big challenge that allows you to use and experiment with many cutting-edge technologies, helping us to continue iterating on our production environment at scale.

Key Responsibilities

  • Take full ownership of our testing set-up, framework and environment
    • Identify test requirements and design coverage plans.
    • Develop, document and maintain functional test cases and other test artifacts like test data, data validation and automated scripts.
    • Evaluate automated test cases and report results in ways that are easily digestible to the rest of the team
    • Enable the team to scale their testing, without becoming a bottleneck yourself
  • Ensure all testing products are built to an appropriate level of quality for the stage (alpha/beta/production)
  • Deliver products using the appropriate agile project management methodology, learning & iterating frequently
  • Work with our Head of Engineering to define the right approach and priorities to improve our testing

REQUIREMENTS

  • A few years of experience developing and/or testing large and complex web applications
    • Experience with NodeJS would be a plus
  • Comfortable both on the front and the back-end of web applications
    • Experience with AngularJS would be a plus
  • A passion for building and using testing frameworks at scale

Qualities

  • You get stuff done.
  • You’re a fire-starter, you can clearly demonstrate your ability to be proactive without direct supervision
  • You like working in an agile development environment
  • Flexible and adaptable, to changing situations and responsibilities

BENEFITS

  • Ownership: we trust you to get sh*t done
  • Live & learn on the cutting-edge: we want to use the best tools for the job, you won't be stuck using older frameworks
  • Never sit still: Yearly swarm weeks at remote locations with the whole team (Portugal is next), Hackdays every quarter and constant innovation across the company lead to real innovation

Anywhere

items.title: Daily Kos: Intermediate/Senior Software QA Engineer
items.content:
Intermediate/Senior Software QA Engineer

Posted Oct 3

Daily Kos
Headquarters: Oakland, CA
https://www.dailykos.com/jobs/intermediatesenior-software-qa-engineer

DailyKos, the leading online progressive blogging and activism platform, is looking for an Intermediate/Senior Software QA Engineer.

DailyKos is a great place to work-- your code will be used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to effect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond. If you want a job that provides more than just a technical challenge, we'd love to hear from you.

The job offers a flexible work environment, the ability to work remotely (U.S. only, please) on a distributed team of self-sufficient collaborators, competitive salary and benefits, and we provide an Apple MacBook Pro or your preferred comparable hardware. Our organization’s commitment to personal growth reduces churn and encourages a very rewarding long term position. We have an energized team filled with great people with different backgrounds.

We are seeking an experienced QA lead to shape the QA function at Daily Kos. Currently most QA at Daily Kos is done manually and the responsibility is spread across a few people on staff who also have other roles. This QA Engineer will be the first dedicated hire for QA and will have a significant role in shaping the department as we expand our development team and build out more capacity for automated testing. Applicants should be self-sufficient and comfortable working independently. In addition we are looking for someone who:

  • can clearly and precisely document bugs and the steps to reproduce them
  • can write and follow detailed test plans for new features
  • can use the JavaScript console, debugger, and other browser developer tools
  • can write and run raw SQL queries in MySQL or PostgreSQL; knowledge of other data storage a plus
  • can read Ruby and JavaScript code 
  • has awareness of typical programming errors and the unexpected things users do whether accidentally or maliciously
  • has exposure to performance and security testing
  • has exposure to front-end automated testing tools
  • can summon a maddeningly creative approach to breaking things and other chaos monkey skills
  • enjoys using the Daily Kos application in general
  • will advocate for our users both internally and externally to ensure they have the reliable tools that they need and do what they need and expect
At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective in our work, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal-opportunity workplace. We're a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees.


Apply for this position

To apply, please send an email to tech_jobs@dailykos.com with the name of the position in the subject line, a cover letter, code sample or github repo and your resume (include your LinkedIn profile link).

Description

Are you ready to build great mobile and web-based applications that help millions of users reach their health goals?

As a Sr. QA Automation Engineer on this team you will design and implement an automation test solution to stress and test a new hybrid mobile app written with AngularJS 2 and Ionic framework.

This contract role may be performed from a remote location and requires a level of effort estimated at 40 hours per week.

Your Duties

  • Identify and implement an automation test solution for an Angular JS 2, Ionic hybrid mobile app
  • Design and document test plans, test cases, bug reports and processes for the device agnostic health improvement mobile app
  • Provide intermittent manual device-based QA testing
  • Consult with team and client regarding QA best practices
  • Collaborate with tight-knit, global, full-stack team

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience working in QA, designing and implementing automation frameworks
  • Prior experience with automated testing using Protractor for Angular 2 or 4
  • Previous experience with Ruby and Calabash is a plus
  • TDD or BDD practices and their associated frameworks like Jasmine, Mocha, Cucumber.
  • Experience with Cucumber and Ruby or Cucumber and Javascript is preferred
  • Previous experience using Appium
  • Experience with Javascript or Ruby, preferably both
  • Experience using AWS Device Farm testing service or similar is nice to have
  • Jenkins, Travis, CircleCI or comparable continuous integration systems
  • Knowledge of Typescript is a big plus
  • Experience with JIRA task and bug tracking system
  • Previous experience working in Agile scrum environment
  • Knowledge on how to configure test jobs via Jenkins / Travis is a plus
  • Firm understanding of mobile application development
  • Track record of active participation and contributions to the testing community (Stack Overflow, QA/automation framework forums, Meetup groups, blogging, Twitter) is nice to have
  • Familiarity with database systems, both SQL and NoSQL (For example, MySQL and MongoDB) is a nice to have
  • Prior experience with setting up and installing VMs is nice to have
  • Grasp of the command line and scripting languages (like Bash and Powershell) is a plus
  • Priority will be given to candidates with previous consulting experience

Let’s Talk about You

You value outcomes above all else: You have a proven track record shipping great mobile and web products. By understanding the big picture, you articulate strategy and vision with strong written and verbal communication.

You Lead by Doing: You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.

You Love Work, Growth and Learning: You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. You’ll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 100 people in 26 countries in 6 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

Why Modus Create

  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to work remotely / telecommute
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging techDo you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech company? Let’s start a conversation.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

You must be willing to co-work a significant portion of the day with clients' business hours - GMT-4. This is a full-time position that may be performed from a remote location. The incumbent must be authorized to work in the USA.
